intro: Peponia dissecta, commonly known as the dissected melon, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant features trailing stems with palmately lobed leaves that are deeply divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its yellow flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a small, oval melon that is typically green when mature.
